talents.name: Rapid Charge Mode

talents.name: Precision Discharge

talents.name: Conducting Charge

talents.name: Street Experience

talents.name: Charging Field
talents.desc: When Anby uses her EX Special Attack, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When she hits an enemy with her Basic Attack or Dash Attack, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, increasing that attack's DMG by 45%.

talents.name: Warm-up Exercises
talents.desc: When Drill Attack hits an enemy, Anton gains additional Energy up to a maximum of 5 Energy per skill use.

talents.name: State of Flow
talents.desc: When Anton uses his EX Special Attack and enters Burst Mode, he gains a Shield that equals to 7.5% of his max HP. While in Burst Mode, entering combat or switching in reapplies the Shield effect. This effect can trigger once every 15s. The Shield dissipates when Burst Mode ends.

talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Everyone Get Fired Up!

talents.name: Break the Limit
talents.desc: When Anton's Piledriver Attack triggers a critical hit, his Basic Attack: Enthusiastic Drills (Burst Mode) and Dodge Counter: Overload Drill (Burst Mode) deal 4% more DMG for 30s, stacking up to 6 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Applies a sizable team-wide Shield when executing his EX combo - something that isn’t necessary in endgame but can be nice to have and allows you to make a few mistakes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The only Defensive character suitable for being played as a Stunning character making him valuable to F2P players without other options.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants all other Fire and Belobog agents 16% Crit Rate while Shielding them, allowing him to stand out from other Stun and Defense-based characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When paired with Koleda will modify and significantly improve her Ultimate and Enhanced Basic Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All characters Corin can play with to activate her additional ability are either other DPS she doesn’t want to be paired with due to her high field time requirements or S-Ranks, making Corin’s team-building options somewhat limited.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Struggles to launch and fully charge her most powerful attacks on enemies without them moving, interrupting her, or needing to cancel the channel in order to reposition resulting in lower damage performance against more active targets.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has an entire kit built around dealing the majority of her damage while the enemy is Stunned causing her to feel somewhat lackluster outside of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Competes with many other A-Rank Physical DPS and even one with a reasonably similar playstyle (Piper).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen is an S-Rank Ice Combat Agent specializing in delivering high amounts of pure Ice damage through her unique burst rotation and her ability to execute EX combos with the team’s Ultimate.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Additionally, she maintains a consistent damage output against less formidable foes using a powerful sustained combo.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen boasts high mobility, enhanced by her signature sprinting state, accessible only to her, which positions her as one of the fastest characters in the game. Her gameplay revolves around managing Flash Freeze charges, a resource exclusive to her, which powers her devastating Enhanced Basic Attacks. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Mastering these mechanics allows Ellen to achieve some of the highest damage outputs in the game, solidifying her status as a top-tier character in the endgame mode, Shiyu Defense.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen is considered one of the more complex characters due to the nuances of her kit and combos. However, mastering her mechanics transforms gameplay into a seamless experience.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Basic Attack is a 3-hit combo integral to both her standard and burst rotations. It features two variants: a standard form dealing Physical damage and an enhanced form consuming Flash Freeze charges to deal Ice damage instead (requiring 3 Flash Freeze for a full 3-hit combo). In both forms, the first and second strikes are swift and relatively weak, while the third strike is a lengthier attack that can be extended further with continuous tapping. The third hit deals the majority of the combo's damage and triggers Ellen's teleportation behind her current or a new target if the original is eliminated or moves.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen possesses standard Dodge, Dodge Counter, and Dash attacks common among characters.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Unique to her is the ability to hold down her Dodge to enter a special sprinting state known as the Roaming State. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This state allows her to remain indefinitely sprinting and transforms her standard Basic Attack into Arctic Ambush, a critical component of her kit. Activating Arctic Ambush exits the Roaming State, delivering a chopping attack with her scissors that generates 1 Flash Freeze charge on hit. Alternatively, holding the Basic Attack button charges Arctic Ambush, increasing its damage and generating 3 Flash Freeze charges (ideal for executing a full Enhanced Basic Attack combo). Charging Arctic Ambush costs Ellen considerable field time, but executing a Perfect Dodge grants her the \"Quick Charge\" buff, significantly speeding up her next Charged Arctic Ambush from roughly 2 seconds to about 1.5 seconds.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Defensive Assist, Assist Follow-Up, and Quick Assist are standard attacks among melee characters, dealing Ice damage and/or inflicting Daze. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Notably, when Ellen performs a Quick Assist, she also gains the \"Quick Charge\" effect mentioned earlier, in addition to her Perfect Dodge bonus.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen possesses 3 Special Attacks: 1 Standard Special and 2 EX Specials. She utilizes her Standard Special sparingly, focusing instead on her EX Specials during burst rotations and situational use within her standard combo. The first EX Special can be activated upon sufficient energy, dealing Ice damage ahead of her, generating 1 Flash Freeze charge, and enabling an immediate Follow-Up with the third attack of her Basic Attack combo. This sequence allows Ellen to swiftly deal damage, generate a charge, and then immediately utilize it in her powerful basic combo, encompassing her entire rotation in a concise sequence. Ellen’s second EX functions similarly but with increased damage and the ability to induce Daze, requiring immediate use after her first EX. This choice gives Ellen flexibility: she can opt for EX1 followed by a Basic 3 or EX1 + EX2 followed by a Basic 3.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Chain Attack and Ultimate, akin to her assists, deliver substantial Ice damage and Daze. Notably, her Chain Attack requires more time to execute compared to other characters.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen’s Core Passive is notably potent, incentivizing her to approach 100% Crit without compromising other stats. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This passive grants up to 100% Crit damage to Arctic Assault and all her Flash Freeze-Enhanced attacks, particularly her Basics. Additionally, her Additional Ability is equally formidable and should be activated as a priority. It grants a buff increasing her Ice damage by 3% each time she deals any Ice damage, stacking up to 10 times for 10 seconds. This ability is easily maintained, effectively providing a consistent 30% boost to Ice damage.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ellen is unequivocally at the forefront of the meta upon her release as a DPS. Once mastered, she proves invaluable both presently and in future gameplay","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". For optimal strategies for combining all of Ellen’s abilities, refer to the Rotation & Teams section of this guide.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the highest damage output in the game at the time of her release,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is part of the best team in the game at the time of her release (Mono-Ice),","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has incredible mobility while in the Roaming state, which allows for quick movement through levels and repositioning around bosses,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many abilities have movement and dodging components built into them, making Ellen more challenging for enemies to hit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the strongest self-buffs built into her kit in the game at the time of her release,","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Only Ice damage dealer at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.desc: Upon hitting an enemy with a Swift Scissors during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush, the obtained Flash Freeze Charges are increased to 3. Upon hitting an enemy with a Charged Scissors strike during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush, the obtained Flash Freeze Charges are increased to 6. For each Flash Freeze Charge consumed, Ellen's CRIT Rate is increased by 2% for 15s, stacking up to 6 times. The duration of each stack is calculated separately.

talents.name: Arctic Ocean Predator
talents.desc: The 3rd hit of Basic Attack: Flash Freeze Trimming can be directly followed up with EX Special Attack: Sharknami. When using an EX Special Attack, each Flash Freeze Charge increases the current attack's CRIT DMG by 20%, up to a max of 60%.

talents.name: Overtime-Intolerant
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Endless Hoarfrost
talents.desc: Whenever a squad member Freezes or Stuns an enemy, Ellen gains 6 Flash Freeze Charges and the Quick Charge effect. She also recovers 4 Energy. The Energy recovery effect can trigger once per 10s.

talents.name: Adequate Sleep
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: The Feast Begins
talents.desc: When Ellen uses an EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or gains Quick Charge, her PEN Ratio increases by 20% for 6s. She also gains 1 stack of The Feast Begins, up to a maximum of 3 stacks. With 3 stacks of The Feast Begins, using a Charge Scissor Strike during Dash Attack: Arctic Ambush consumes all stacks, increasing the DMG of the current attack by 250%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Less Is More, Simple Is Key. Complexity has no place here. Just keep everything simple. Work Smart and Rest More. Take breaks at the right time... to minimize the annoyance of working. Work With Focus, Prevail With Caution. Whether she takes it too seriously or not seriously enough, it's her enemy who ends up suffering from it. Unleash Sweet Delight, Unwrap and Indulge. Savoring the lollipop and concealing her true thoughts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Most attacks have a movement-based component which is controllable by the player making Grace one of the most mobile characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly fast damaging combos allow Grace to be played alongside another damage dealer as a Sub-dps without her competing for field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals the majority of her damage through Shock which after applied can be triggered by other characters while Grace isn’t even on the field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The backbone of the Shock team archetype making her a must-have if you want to play that team on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly cheap EX Special meaning it will be available far more frequently than other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly active playstyle requiring accumulation and spending of charges on top of constant movement. Good for players who like a lot of action.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Constant movement on abilities can sometimes lead to Grace being out of position if not controlled correctly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Re-applying a Shock to an already Shocked target will not deal any additional damage but only refresh the duration making spamming out Shocks, while possible, a less efficient use of Grace's resources (Disorder can be used to solve this issue somewhat).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong damage potential but less straightforward to play as a sole damage dealer than other characters and prefers to be played alongside another damage dealer (such as Anton) in most cases.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her best and incredibly synergistic support (Rina) is an S-Rank and playing without her is noticeable, limiting Grace’s free-to-play power on release unless you get lucky.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Recharge Chamber
talents.desc: When the 4th hit of Grace's Basic Attack hits an enemy, all squad members gain 0.25 Energy. Within the same move, this effect can grant a max of 2 Energy to all squad members.

talents.name: Lightning Piercer
talents.desc: When Grace's grenade hits an enemy during a Basic Attack, Special Attack, or EX Special Attack, the target's Electric RES is reduced by 8.5%, and Electric Anomaly Buildup RES is reduced by 8.5%, lasting for 8s.

talents.name: Chief Mechanic
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Burst Capacitor
talents.desc: When Grace uses her EX Special Attack, she gains 6 stacks of Charge (max 6 stacks). When her Basic Attack or Dash Attack hits an enemy, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, increasing her Energy Generation Rate of the attack by 20%.

talents.name: Frosty Cold Iron Witch
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Detonation Trigger
talents.desc: When all Zap stacks are consumed to activate a Special Attack or EX Special Attack, Grace's skill is enhanced, tossing an extra grenade and increasing each grenade's DMG to 200%.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Such sharp and strong lines, truly beautiful... I can't help but want to open it up and take a look. \"Did you say Grace?\" Wrench jumped in and answered: \"Hm, she's the first person I've met nice enough to give me a massage.\" \"She's genuinely caring,\" Screw quickly added: \"Rather than being tightly wound, I prefer her way of tightening screws just right.\" Gear joined in at this point: \"Her intelligent mind is alluring and elegant as a well-engaged gearbox!\" \"And very rational,\" Oil muttered: \"In her dictionary, there's no room for 'a little' or 'moderate amount'. It's all precise 'milliliters'.\"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jane Doe, an S-Rank Melee Physical Combat Agent, excels in delivering exceptionally high damage through frequent triggers of the Assault Anomaly. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"What distinguishes Jane from the typical Anomaly-based characters is her unparalleled mobility, rapid Anomaly build-up speed, a unique berserk mode called \"Passion State,\" and the ability to cause her assaults to critically strike. Mastering and synergizing these elements is key to her success, and in the hands of a skilled player, Jane can effortlessly dominate endgame content across various team compositions, making her one of the most formidable DPS characters at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At the heart of Jane’s kit is the Passion Stream or simply \"Passion,\" a unique resource gauge that is exclusive to her and serves as the foundation for all her combat actions. Engaging in any damaging ability, executing Perfect Dodges, or performing Defensive Assists will generate Passion. Once the Passion gauge is fully charged, Jane enters a temporary berserk mode known as Passion State. This state enhances her abilities, increases her Physical Anomaly Buildup Rate by 25%, and grants her an additional 2 flat Combat Attack points for each point of Anomaly Proficiency she possesses over 120, capping at 600 flat Attack (which maxes out at 420 Anomaly Proficiency). The combined effects of these benefits transform Jane into an absolute powerhouse during this state. However, maintaining the Passion State indefinitely is a challenge, as her abilities that generate Passion also consume it. Once her Passion gauge depletes to 0, she exits the state. Jane's primary objective, along with the rest of her kit, revolves around entering and sustaining the Passion State for as long as possible to maximize her destructive potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane Doe’s has two distinct Basic Attacks: a relatively standard six-part attack combo and a less conventional, but far more powerful, charge-and-hold attack called \"Basic Attack: Salchow Jump.\" The latter can only be used once per entry into the Passion State, making it a critical tool in Jane's offensive repertoire. Jane's standard six-part basic attack combo serves the dual purpose of building and consuming Passion and acts as Jane's filler ability, used when no other skills or opportunities are available. As with other characters, the latter attacks in Jane's combo are more powerful, and she can skip the earlier parts by executing Basic Attacks after specific actions. This allows for some exceptionally satisfying and potent combinations. Notably, many of these combination attacks vary depending on whether Jane is in the Passion State, providing unique sequences that enhance her overall damage output.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane’s charge-and-hold attack, Basic Attack: Salchow Jump, is a game-changer. This powerful move causes Jane to spin rapidly, dealing tremendous damage to nearby enemies for as long as the attack is held. Upon releasing the attack or when the ability is canceled, Jane performs a powerful finishing move in front of her. While spinning, Jane enjoys a 40% reduction in damage taken and gains Anti-Interrupt capabilities. During the finishing move, she becomes completely invulnerable. What truly sets this ability apart is its ability to restore Passion, regardless of whether Jane is in the Passion State. This means that using this attack not only inflicts massive damage but also extends Jane’s time in the Passion State, reducing downtime and making it a must-use ability at every opportunity—preferably after entering the Passion State and spending some Passion, so she can immediately recover it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane's agility is further enhanced by her unique Dodge, Dash Attacks, and Dodge Counters. She has distinct versions of these moves depending on whether she is in the Passion State. While the animations differ—becoming notably cooler in the Passion State—their primary function remains consistent: they are \"stronger\" variants of their non-Passion counterparts.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Unlike most characters, Jane has access to three charges of Dodge instead of the usual two. Her standard non-Passion Dodge also features two alternating animations, though this does not impact its functionality. In the Passion State, Jane’s Dodge is upgraded, allowing her to dodge through enemies rather than just away from them. Additionally, executing Perfect Dodges within the Passion State generates Passion, further extending her damage windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane's non-Passion Dash Attack comes in two variants, corresponding to her separate dodge animations. Both variants deal the same damage, and outside these differences, Jane's Dash Attacks are fairly standard. However, in the Passion State, the Dash Attack is enhanced, taking longer to execute, dealing more damage, and covering more distance. Jane can also follow her Passion-enhanced dash attacks with a basic attack skip to execute the following combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash Attack: Phantom Thrust (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P4 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P5 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P6 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane’s standard Dodge Counters, like her Dash Attacks, have two different animations but function as typical Dodge Counters. Her Passion-enhanced Dodge Counter is stronger overall but lacks unique benefits. Executing either of the standard Dodge Counters followed by Basic Attacks allows Jane to perform the following basic-skipping combos, which are ideal for quickly building up and returning to the Passion State:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Swift Shadow","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades Passion State, Jane can execute a stronger combo:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge one of her most potent abilities, dealing significant damage and building up Anomaly with considerable efficiency. Despite its power, it does not integrate into any specific combo and lacks additional effects beyond the standard Passion spend/generation. Therefore, it’s advisable to use this ability during the Passion State, ideally when your team is at its peak strength and the enemy is most vulnerable (such as when stunned).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane’s Chain Attack and Ultimate are both devastating in terms of damage and Anomaly build-up. However, their most significant feature is their ability to instantly fill and activate (or reactivate) her Passion State. These attacks provide an invaluable shortcut to establishing and maintaining the Passion State, allowing for more frequent use of Basic Attack: Salchow Jump. Reactivating the Passion State refreshes your ability to use this attack, offering even greater opportunities to extend Jane’s already impressive damage output.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane Doe's Quick Assists, Defensive Assists, and Assist Follow-Ups are all standard attacks that can seamlessly integrate into her combat flow. Notably, Jane has Quick Assists for both her Passion and Non-Passion states, allowing her to execute Basic Attack-skipping combos with precision and flair. Below are some key combos that highlight her potential:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Quick Assist Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Quick Assist: Lutz Jump (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P5 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P6 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Defensive Assist Combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Defensive Assist: Last Defense","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Gale (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P4 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P5 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Dancing Blades P6 (Passion)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane’s Core Passive: Insight enhances all her attacks by applying the \"Gnawed State\" to enemies for 10 seconds. This passive also grants Jane the unprecedented ability to cause the Assault Anomaly to critically strike—something typically outside the realm of possibility. When an Assault triggers against an enemy in the Gnawed State, the chance for a Critical strike is set at a base of 40%. This chance can be increased by 0.16% for each point of Anomaly Proficiency Jane possesses, capping at 100% at 375 Anomaly Proficiency (at max level). The critical damage modifier is fixed at 1.5x, unaffected by other sources of Crit or Crit Damage (outside of Mindscapes). Additionally, assaults against Gnawed enemies will extend the \"Flinch\" debuff by 5 seconds with each hit, making Jane's attacks not only more potent but also more debilitating over time.\n \nJane's Additional Ability: Sore Spot is activated by having any Anomaly or same-faction character on her team and significantly boosts her Anomaly Buildup Rate. It provides an unconditional 20% bonus and an additional 15% when Jane attacks enemies already suffering from an Attribute Anomaly. This powerful enhancement is essential for maximizing Jane’s damage potential, and fortunately, it’s easy to activate.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane Doe stands out as one of the most formidable Physical DPS agents at the time of her release. Her exceptional mobility, ability to deliver burst damage without ramp-up time (despite being Anomaly-based), and flexibility within the disorder archetype make her a force to be reckoned with across a variety of team compositions. Whether she’s the sole damage dealer or working alongside other Anomaly characters, Jane’s future prospects are undeniably bright.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"For optimal strategies and to fully harness the power of Jane’s abilities, refer to the Rotation & Teams section of this guide.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible mobility and 3 Dashes.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Absurdly fast and consistent Physical Anomaly buildup resulting in very frequent Assault Triggers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can cause Assault to critically strike - an additional multiplier not accessible to any other Anomaly character at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong damage in and outside of burst windows, making her viable all throughout the duration of combat.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can drastically extend her Passion State in the hands of a skilled player thanks to multiple abilities resetting and extending the state when used optimally.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can be used as a sole DPS or alongside other Anomaly characters in Disorder teams giving her great team-building flexibility and future prospects.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When not taking advantage of her Chain Attack or the team's Ultimate Jane requires meaningful field time to enter and take advantage of the Passion State.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can lose significant power if enough Anomaly Proficiency cannot be acquired in order to activate her scaling abilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can sometimes lose meaningful damage due to the Anomaly Trigger cooldown and the Anomaly Ability cap (Abilities that can only Trigger Assault at the end of their animation and can waste build-up if it exceeds 100% before the end of the animation)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Crime Counsel
talents.desc: The maximum uses of Basic Attack: Salchow Jump are increased by one. While in the Passion state, Jane's Physical Anomaly Buildup Rate increases by an extra 15% and each point of Jane's Anomaly Proficiency increases her damage by 0.1%, up to a maximum of 30%.

talents.name: Adapt to the Environment
talents.desc: When Jane's attack hits an enemy in the Gnawed state, or when any squad member triggers Assault on an enemy in the Gnawed state, 15% of the enemy's DEF is ignored. Additionally, when Assault DMG triggers a CRIT, the CRIT DMG is increased by 30%.

talents.name: Anonymity
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Adapt and Thrive
talents.desc: When any squad member triggers the Assault or Disorder effects, all squad members' Attribute Anomaly DMG is increased by 18%, lasting 15s.

talents.name: Compulsive Hoarder
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Shady Technique
talents.desc: While in the Passion state, Jane's CRIT Rate increases by 20%, and CRIT DMG by 40%. After any squad member inflicts Assault, Jane instantly enters the Passion state, and gains max Passion Stream. When Assault deals a CRIT, Jane performs an additional attack on the target, dealing Physical DMG equal to 1,600% of her Anomaly Proficiency.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Jane, a criminal behavior specialist, has had a \"colorful\" career as a consultant with Public Security over the years. She is an expert in disguise, infiltration, and other investigative work. She has a bad habit of trolling others and sometimes plays harmless pranks. She's a skilled mimic, able to change her appearance and demeanor at will, making people wonder what the \"real\" Jane is like. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains temporary invincibility during the enhanced portions of her basic attack sequence allowing Koleda to ignore hits and finish her combo instead of dodging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to play to her full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Combining Koleda’s EX with an enhanced basic attack sequence delivers devastating amounts of daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gain’s empowered abilities when in a party with Ben changing and improving some of her kit.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability (gained by having a Belobog or Fire teammate) is nice but not a dealbreaker to lose making Koleda feel fine to splash into team archetypes she doesn’t have direct synergy in (she can be used in every team without you feeling bad for losing something).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has attack animations on the slower side with some attacks that lock her into completing them, sometimes causing Koleda to end up out of position unless you perform a character swap during them.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Non-enhanced basic attacks feel lackluster compared to her EX-enhanced basic combo making her feel somewhat EX-reliant outside of parrying and dodge countering.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Nothing that makes her outstanding outside of her great Daze and being a Fire element makes her subject to power creep.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Beat of the Hammer

talents.name: Furnace’s Glow
talents.desc: Koleda gains one stack of Charge (max 2 stacks) when consuming Furnace Fire to use her Enhanced Basic Attack. When her Chain Attack or Ultimate hits an enemy, she consumes all stacks of Charge to increase the attack's DMG by 18% per stack.

talents.name: Saturated Blast

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Small & Cute, With Some Fierce Combat Power. She may be small, but can certainly wield that huge hammer. A Fierce Young Girl Who's Also a President. The young leader at the helm of Belobog Industries. A President Who Leads by Example. She prefers to work out in the field, rather than being stuck at a desk. Leads by Example While Maintaining Her Cute Nature.\nHer maturity sometimes gives way to occasional childishness. She's a leader who sometimes needs to be taken care of by her followers.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has up to 3 pet guard boars that attack, dealing a small amount of damage and Daze.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guard boars stay on the field and keep attacking even while Lucy leaves the field.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the whole squad (including Bangboo and guard boars) a 600 flat ATK buff, assuming Lucy’s own personal Attack is high enough to cap out the buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very very easy to play without much to do or mess up in order to bring out her full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has different teams she is very very good in and a few where she is even the best - making her flexibility in teams incredibly good.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Doesn’t require her additional ability in order to fully unlock her supportive capabilities although she will lose some of her potential guard boar damage.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has two separate EX moves to choose from depending on the situation at hand.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Guard boars can sometimes have trouble keeping up and hitting faster enemies in melee range, leading to them chasing enemies instead of constantly attacking.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires a high amount of personal Attack to grant her allies the full most powerful 600 flat Attack buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Ironfist Overseer
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chaos Ball Game
talents.desc: While in the Cheer On! state, allies' CRIT DMG is increased by an additional 10%.

talents.name: Wildland Princess
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Fierce Fangs of Fire
talents.desc: When an ally in the Cheer On! state hits an enemy with an EX Special Attack, a guard boar will drop from the sky and cause an explosion, dealing Fire DMG equal to 300% of the guard boar's ATK. This will extend the duration of the Cheer On! buff for all squad members by 5s. The duration can increase up to 3 times, with a maximum duration of 30s. Refreshing the Cheer On! state resets the stack count. After the guard boar's explosion, it will launch Guard Boars: Spinning Swing!.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"An honored guest just arrived. Allow me, Lady Lucy, to entertain you!\" Luciana Auxesis Theodoro de Montefio ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability amplifies the standard Stun multiplier from 150% to 185% increasing team burst damage during the Stun window tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core ability applies 25% Ice Res Shred for 30 seconds allowing for near infinite uptime on enemies boosting the damage of Ice characters by an incredible amount.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals massive amounts of Daze unconditionally with his charged basic attack combo allowing him to act as a main field Dazer delivering absurd Daze on the field while still having the option to support a Main DPS with Parries and EX’s when they are available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has access to incredible teammates, allowing Lycaon to form one of the strongest teams in the game (Mono-Ice).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite being incredible in Ice damage-focused teams, he can still provide value outside of them thanks to his incredible Daze and bonus stun multiplier.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Charging up basic attacks and chaining them together requires a mild amount of timing to ensure time isn’t wasted in between each attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has great AoE coverage on her Ultimate, Chain, and Dodge Counter allowing for easy cleanup of weaker enemies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Multiple team synergies among free-to-play characters even if they aren’t as strong as other characters' best teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible mobility with a Dash Attack that is a borderline teleport.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Fast attacking and dodge-based kit perfect for those who enjoy a fast-paced playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly cheap EX Special meaning it will be available far more frequently than other characters.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires constant use of Dodge Counters or Quick Assists in order to keep her Core passive ability active whereas many other characters get theirs permanently active for free.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"During Stun damage windows when the enemy cannot attack, Nekomata must rely on her Support to grant her a Quick Assist or go without a large damage bonus.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Is a Physical damage dealer and there are three A-Rank characters from this element - one of which is free - meaning she has by far the most competition for her role within her element, making her relative value compared to other elemental S-Rank drop.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has incredibly limited team synergy options. There is no Physical support or Stun characters and the characters from her faction Cunning Hares only have mediocre synergy with her at best. This results in lower endgame potential for her at the time of her release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\"The best mackerel is always the one you haven't eaten yet~\" — Nekomiya Mana. Spirited and mischievous, she likes to play tricks on others. Your wallet is her wallet. (Really... It's hers now.) pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can apply a very large Defense Shred debuff on enemies increasing the damage they take considerably.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Increases the entire squads' Ether damage by 25% while her Additional Ability is active","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She’s free!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"One of the only characters that synergizes with characters such as Billy and Nekomata due to the limited roster of characters on release in 1.0.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has two pet Bangboo puppets she casts all her abilities with - they hang around on the field after she casts abilities for a short while before returning to her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the incredibly generic buff that while Bangboos are on the field Rina grants 25% of her PEN ratio + a flat amount up to a limit of 30% to all team members, increasing the whole team’s damage tremendously.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Additional ability increases all Shock durations from 10 seconds to 13 seconds resulting in higher Shock uptime and 30% more total damage if all Shocks have the chance to run their full duration (essential for Shock teams). Also grants the team 10% Electric damage while there is a Shocked enemy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Pen Ratio buff is universal enough to always be helpful in any team and the Shock duration extension is unique enough that it’s unlikely Rina will become replaced too quickly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very easy to understand and play outside of ensuring Rina’s Bangboo’s stay deployed.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very high movement speed, ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dash distance and can attack while slightly moving making Rina one of the highest mobility characters in the game (next to Grace).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Many abilities last multiple seconds and occupy Rina’s Bangboos, restricting her from casting another ability until the last one finishes - this makes the use of Rina’s abilities in quick succession challenging.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bangboos need to be constantly redeployed in order to take advantage of Rina’s Pen Ratio buff, meaning you’ll need to stay on top of weaving her attacking in between your other characters as much as possible.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.name: Head Maid Perfectionist
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A Midsummer Night's Dance. A delicate and gentle melody flows naturally through Rina's movements. Twisted Fate Concerto. Additional music performed by the dolls, best enjoyed with attentive ears. New World Symphony. Stirring, powerful, and elegant. Rina is as elegant as ever, even when beating people up. Silent Sonata Pathetique. The soundtrack that resonates in many people's minds when they see Rina step into the kitchen.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth is an A-Rank Electric Melee Defense Agent who excels in Support roles, offering potent Anomaly buffs and shields to both himself and a designated ally. Despite his minimal on-field presence, Seth contributes significantly to Daze and Anomaly buildup, making him a versatile addition to any team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's abilities center around a unique resource called Resolve, which can be accumulated up to 100%. This resource fuels a powerful Enhanced Basic Attack, which triggers a Special Quick Assist for the character positioned before Seth in the squad order, unlike standard Quick Assists, which activate for the next character in line. Seth’s Quick Assist enhances the performance of the preceding squad member, granting them a substantial shield and a powerful Attribute Anomaly buff for an extended duration. Outside of his Chain Attacks, mastering Seth's kit requires understanding how to maximize this shield and buff for your chosen ally (to be chosen before mission starts) while keeping Seth’s field time to a minimum.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s effectiveness hinges on his Core Passive, Protector, and Additional Ability, High Spirit—these are the cornerstones of his support capabilities.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Core Passive grants Seth a shield equal to 80% of his initial ATK every time he uses his EX Special Attack, with a maximum cap of 3000 for 25 seconds and a 10-second cooldown. Notably, the shield’s strength is tied to Seth’s initial ATK, meaning it remains unaffected by any in-combat ATK buffs. What you see on his stat page before a mission is what you get in battle. When Seth triggers a Quick Assist via his Charged Hold Basic Attack or Assist Follow-Up, the same shield, with identical scaling, cap, and duration, is granted to the ally benefiting from the assist. Additionally, all squad members, including Seth, who are shielded by this effect, gain a significant 100 additional Anomaly Proficiency at max rank. However, due to the mechanics of Seth’s shields, only himself and the preceding squad member in order can benefit from this buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Additional Ability is simpler but no less impactful. It requires at least one squadmate to share Seth’s Attribute or Faction to activate. When active, Seth’s Chain Attack or Charged Hold Basic Attack reduces the enemy's Anomaly Buildup Resistance by 20% for 20 seconds. This debuff significantly enhances Anomaly team performance, increasing overall damage and consistency by accelerating Anomaly application. Since both attacks that apply this effect are integral to Seth’s gameplay, maintaining this debuff is straightforward and can be done with ease almost permanently.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth wields two distinct basic attack forms: a standard 4-part combo and a specialized Charged Hold Basic Attack. While his standard combo is rarely employed—owing to its lack of Resolve generation and contribution to team utility—we shall bypass its details and instead focus on the Charged Hold Basic Attack, which is far more crucial to Seth's role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's Charged Basic Attack, known as Lightning Strike - Electrified, is the linchpin of his offensive and supportive toolkit. This attack requires and consumes 75% of his Resolve bar to activate. Upon execution, Seth unleashes a series of lightning-infused slashes, culminating in a powerful finishing move that deals moderate Daze and Electric Anomaly damage. As previously discussed in relation to Seth’s Core Passive and Additional Ability, this attack is indispensable for triggering his unique Quick Assist, which applies a shield to an ally, as well as for maintaining the Anomaly Resistance Reduction debuff on enemies. Therefore, building up and spending 75% Resolve to activate this attack should always be prioritized. Fortunately, achieving this is relatively straightforward, thanks to his EX Special Attack.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's EX Special Attack is one of his most reliable and efficient methods for accumulating Resolve. By consuming 80 energy, Seth releases a barrage of heavy Electric attacks that inflict substantial Daze and Electric Anomaly damage. More importantly, this attack immediately grants Seth 75% Resolve, making it an essential component of his rotation. The synergy between the EX Special and his Charged Hold Basic Attack forms the backbone of his primary combo. This combo should be employed whenever the energy is available, and when either Seth, his designated ally, or the enemy lacks the buffs or debuffs from his Core Passive or Additional Ability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's EX Special can be further enhanced by holding the EX button, thereby charging the attack at cost of additional time. While this increases the damage, Daze, and Anomaly application, it does not affect Resolve generation. The additional charge time can be significant, but it can be shortened by executing the charge immediately following a Chain Attack, Ultimate, Dodge Counter, Assist Follow-Up, or Quick Assist. Furthermore, Seth can reduce the recovery time of the Charged EX by performing a Dash Cancel after the final strike, or by swapping to another character while Seth completes the attack. While the Charged EX can provide a slight boost to Seth's damage, Daze, and Anomaly output, it is entirely optional. Skipping the charge in favor of the standard EX Special will not hinder Seth’s supportive capabilities and may even result in gaining extra field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth's Chain Attack and Ultimate both deliver the expected damage, Daze, and Anomaly effects typical for a defense-oriented character like him. However, they also share a crucial trait: each generates 75% Resolve upon use. The Resolve generation from the Chain Attack, combined with the reapplication of Seth’s 20% Anomaly Resistance Reduction, makes it highly valuable. Utilizing Chain Attacks whenever possible, without causing a significant damage loss, alleviates the pressure of relying solely on Seth’s EX Special to access his Charged Hold Basic Attack. This, in turn, ensures that one of his most critical supportive bonuses remains consistently active. On the other hand, Seth’s Ultimate, while potent, is less essential. Given the ample Resolve generation provided by his EX Specials and Chain Attacks, the Ultimate does not offer enough additional benefit to justify its use in most scenarios.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth’s Quick Assist is rather unremarkable and seldom utilized. However, the synergy between his Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up is where his true potential shines. Using Seth’s Assist Follow-Up similarly to his Enhanced Hold Basic Attack triggers a Quick Assist, which, like the Basic Attack, can grant all of Seth’s Core Passive bonuses to a teammate. This makes it a viable alternative in combat, particularly when Resolve or energy is in short supply.\nSeth’s Dodge, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter are fairly standard and are rarely called upon in his usual supportive gameplay, given their minimal impact on his primary role.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth emerges as a formidable Anomaly support powerhouse, yet his playstyle is refreshingly straightforward. He only requires the execution of one simple combo to effectively apply all his buffs, shields, and debuffs:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Standard Combo ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Thunder Shield Rush - High Voltage (Generates 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Lightning Strike - Electrified (Consumes 75% Resolve)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Team Mate Quick Assist","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite the simplicity of his core combo, Seth boasts an array of tricks, alternative combo sequences, and options to further enhance his performance. These elements collectively position him as a top-tier character within the Anomaly archetype, offering both ease of use and depth for those willing to explore his full potential.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Very simple playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"High duration buff/debuff uptime and they are also easy to apply, which makes keeping them all active easy.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Takes up minimal field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Offers decent Defensive shields.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants a big Anomaly efficiency bonus to himself and an ally of your choosing.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Debuffs enemies causing them to lose 20% Anomaly Buildup Resistance of all element types.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can only consistently buff himself and 1 other teammate with his shield and Anomaly Efficiency.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Attack animations on most important attacks his EX Special and Charged Held Basic are on the slower side.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Seth, a rookie officer in the Public Security Criminal Investigation Special Response Team, is a key player in providing fire support during criminal investigations. He graduated at the top of his class in the academy and could have landed a higher position, but he chose the tougher path of the Special Response Team. His impressive profile makes him seem like a genius, but he's actually a hard worker who has had his own struggles. There have been times when he practiced the subjects he wasn't good at until he cried.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a full team of competitive A-Rank options (Ben as Stun and Lucy as Support) with the option to upgrade the team further with the addition of another S-Rank (Koleda) on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Only Fire damage dealer on release.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly simple playstyle once you get the hang of it.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Core Passive and Additional ability are a pile of free damage that doesn’t require you to do anything.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"No stand-out features other than good damage output, putting her at risk of power creep from another Fire DPS that does her job better.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic attacks have a special “timed” mechanic, requiring you to pause a short moment in between each attack in order to deal maximum damage. build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Rapid Heat
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 enters combat or switches in, if her Energy is less than 40, her Energy is recovered to 80. This effect can trigger once every 50s.

talents.name: Scorching Convergence
talents.desc: When triggering Fire Suppression, Basic Attack, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter DMG increases by 3%, up to 12 stacks, lasting 15s, with the duration of each stack calculated separately.

talents.name: Elite Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Indulgent Blaze
talents.desc: If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 1st, 2nd, or 3rd hit of Soldier 11's Basic Attack or a Dash Attack, Anti-Interrupt Level increases and DMG received is reduced by 18% during skill activation. If Fire Suppression is triggered during the 4th hit of her Basic Attack, she becomes invulnerable during skill activation.

talents.name: Perfect Soldier
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Scorching Flow
talents.desc: When Soldier 11 uses her EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, or Ultimate, she gains 8 stacks of Charge (max 8 stacks). When Fire Suppression is triggered, 1 stack of Charge is consumed, causing the current move to ignore 25% of the target's Fire RES.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A model soldier who follows orders and stays loyal to the mission... At least that's what Soldier 11 demands of herself. Weapons don't need emotions, and need only follow orders... At least that's what Soldier 11 tells herself. No matter how strong the enemy, just get fired up and face it head on... At least that's what Soldier 11 does. She's shed her weakness along with her name, leaving only resolve... At least that's what Soldier 11 thinks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Gains a buff that grants herself an absurd 1000 flat Attack that can be transferred to the next character that switches in after using Fly the Flag normally or as a part of a chain skill. Transferring this ATK buff to your main damage dealer makes Soukaku one of the most potent supports in the game for this alone.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Grants the team 20% additional Ice damage after consuming a full set of 3 Vortex charges - something that can be done easily and continually after a short ramp-up time at the start of the fight.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All buffs Soukaku applies last a long time meaning they can be maintained indefinitely if managed carefully.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Deals a strong amount of Ice anomaly with most of the attacks she uses when played as a dedicated Support, allowing her to help Freeze and Shatter enemies interrupting their movement and sometimes extending stun durations.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Despite having an Ice-themed additional ability can still be used to support non-Ice damaging characters thanks to her incredibly powerful 1000 possible flat Attack buff.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Requires a high amount of personal Attack in order to gain and grant her most powerful 1000 flat Attack buff to herself or allies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"When activating Fly the Flag to gain her flat Attack buff Soukaku is only capable of gaining the full 1000 potential flat ATK if she consumes 3 Vortex charges which must first be built by using her EX. Casting Fly the Flag without consuming Vortex Charges will only grant 500 flat ATK.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX ability feels sluggish to use, opening up Soukaku to getting attacked while using it. While this is a problem it can be mitigated by immediately switching after using the EX.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX does not grant a quick assist to the next character like most other support characters. Instead, Soukaku’s quick assist is tied to her Fly the Flag ability which is accessed by holding down the Special Attack regardless if she has enough energy or not.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

talents.desc: While in the Frosted Banner state, the number of usable enhanced Basic Attacks and enhanced Dash Attacks is increased to 12, and also deal 45% more DMG.
