review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan is a Ranged/Melee hybrid S-Rank Ether Combat Agent specializing in delivering massive Ether Burst damage to stunned enemies with her unique ammunition system","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". Known for her high mobility, Zhu Yuan integrates multiple Dash attacks into her optimal damaging combos, allowing her to reposition mid-attack and implement Invulnerability frames while dealing optimal damage.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s kit revolves around her Shotgun Shell gauge, which can hold up to 9 Enhanced Shells. These shells empower her Basic and Dash Attacks. She switches between two modes of attack: Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":": This mode includes most of her Default Attack sequences. It deals low damage but focuses on generating Enhanced Shotgun Shells.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":": This mode features high-damage Charged Attacks. It can be accessed by holding down the basic attack, causing Zhu Yuan to perform a backflip before entering Suppressive Mode. In this mode, while holding, Zhu Yuan continuously consumes 1-3 Enhanced Shotgun Shells to deal massive damage with her attacks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan has some of the most varied combos available in the game, with each offering unique benefits in different situations. Learning and mastering them all is quite a challenge. Fortunately, it’s possible to focus on the most commonly used, highest-damage combos, which this guide will cover. Zhu Yuan has access to two completely different basic attack combos, one for each Suppressive and Assault mode.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks consist of a six-part attack combo (despite the game only listing five of the six parts). Here is the breakdown of the combo:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P1: Physical Melee Kick","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P2: Ether Ranged Shotgun Blast","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P3: Physical Melee Multi-Kick","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P4: Ether Ranged Shotgun Jump Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P5: Ether Ranged Shotgun Dash Blast (Generates 1 Shell)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P6: Ether Ranged Shotgun Slide","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The most valuable attacks in this sequence are Basic P4 and P5, as they deal the best damage and also generate Zhu Yuan's shells. Ideally, we’d like to access these as frequently as possible.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Another unique aspect of Zhu Yuan’s basic attacks is that she can weave in a Dash Attack after any of the combo sequences above by triggering a Basic Attack by holding down the directional key. In this guide, we’ll be talking specifically about her left and right Dash Attacks (they’re the same as each other), as they are the most effective in her kit and the ones you should be using whenever mentioned. Dashing after attacks in this way will alter the sequencing of her next attack depending on which you dashed after. Here is a list of how using a side dash after each part of the Assault Mode basic attack changes things:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P1 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P2 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P3 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P4 -> Dash Attack -> Assault Mode Basic P5 (Avoid)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P5 -> Dash Attack -> Loop to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Optimal)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P6 -> Dash Attack -> Loop Back to Assault Mode Basic P3 (Avoid)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The changes to attack ordering allow Zhu Yuan to execute higher damage, faster combos that generate more shells. Here is an example of a combo in action:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P1","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dash Attack","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dash Attack","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P4","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assault Mode Basic P5","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"By using Dash Attacks, we can speed up Zhu Yuan’s standard rotation and loop/skip to the best parts of it.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s other Basic Attack moves are within Suppressive Mode, which, as mentioned above, needs to be entered by holding down the Basic Attack and waiting for Zhu Yuan to perform a short preparatory flip. The time needed for Zhu Yuan to enter Suppressive Mode is roughly 0.5 seconds, long enough that you don’t want to be constantly moving in and out of Assault and Suppressive unless necessary. The best approach is to enter Suppressive mode only when you have sufficient Enhanced Shells to consume (5 or 9 being optimal). Additionally, several abilities in Zhu Yuan’s kit allow her to immediately enter Suppressive Mode without delay as long as you immediately begin using Suppressive Mode Basics right after they finish. These abilities are:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ultimate Attack","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Chain Attack","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After entering Suppression mode, continuously holding down the Basic Attack will cause Zhu Yuan to fire an Enhanced Shotgun combo consisting of 3 parts which if available, will each consume a number of Shotgun Shells to deal either tiny Physical (un-enhanced) or massive Ether damage (enhanced). Due to the poor multipliers on Zhu Yuan’s un-enhanced Suppressive Basics it’s never worth using them without Shells available. Here is how many Shells each attack uses:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 = 1 Shell","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 = 1 Shell","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 = 3 Shells (Deals triple the damage of P1 and P2)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Just like Zhu Yuan’s Assault Mode Basic Attacks, she can also make use of a special Suppressive Mode Dodge Attack to alter and improve her Basic Attack sequences. We’ll again be making use of side Dash Attacks (left and right) as they are the most competitive in most cases. Here is how dashes affect the combo:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 -> Suppressive Mode Dash Attack -> Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (Loop)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The key takeaway here is that we can use a Suppressive Mode Dash Attack following a Suppressive Mode Basic P3 to skip straight back to another P3 incredibly quickly, allowing us to consume our Shells much faster and increase Zhu Yuan’s burst potential. Here is an example combo that dumps all 9 Shells as fast as possible (a full gauge):","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P1 (1 Shell)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P2 (1 Shell)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3 (3 Shells) ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Dash Attack (1 Shell)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Suppressive Mode Basic P3  (3 Shells)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As mentioned above, Zhu Yuan has a Dash Attack for both Assault Mode and Suppressive Mode. For both modes, she has different Dash attacks for forward, back, left and right, but left and right are primarily used in both modes for her combos. They can be not only used mid-combo for cancels but also in general combat outside of combos.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s Dodge Counter is a quick Shotgun Blast that deals Ether damage and generates 1 Shotgun Shell, making it an optimal way to stack up Shells quickly against fast-attacking enemies. Following this Dodge Counter, Zhu Yuan skips straight to her Assault Mode Basic P3, allowing her to quickly chain attacks together if desired.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up both launch a Shotgun Blast dealing Ether damage and generating Shotgun Shells. Her Quick Assist generates 1 Shell and her Assist Follow-Up generates 3.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s EX Special Attack, Chain Attack, and Ultimate are all functionally the same but with varying damage multipliers. All of them trigger massive Shotgun Blasts that immediately place Zhu Yuan in Suppressive Mode allowing for immediate usage of Suppressive Mode Basics and generating 3 Shells each.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"To round off her kit, Zhu Yuan features an incredible Core Passive as well as an Additional Ability, both of which tremendously boost her damage output. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s Core Passive boosts the damage of all her Shell-Enhanced Suppressive Mode Basic Attacks and Dash Attacks by up to 40%, further increasing against Stunned targets by another 40% for a total of 80%. She also gains 6 Shells at the start of each combat. Meanwhile, with her Additional Ability if Zhu Yuan has a Support character or a character sharing either her Faction in the team, she’ll gain 30% Crit Rate for 10 seconds after using an EX Special, Chain, or Ultimate. This buff is all but guaranteed to be permanently active during Zhu Yuan’s main burst window where she unloads all her Shells (usually against Stunned enemies). ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Zhu Yuan’s build-and-spend kit plays perfectly into a Burst damage playstyle where she can build up Shells, Energy, and her Ultimate to unleash absolute devastation on Stunned enemies in an incredibly short amount of time. At the time of her release, Zhu Yuan delivers the most Burst damage during a Stun window in the game, assuming she has all her kit at her disposal.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan is the new highest Burst DPS during Stun windows.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She has a strong F2P-friendly support in Nicole.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan possesses exceptional mobility options that not only do not lower her damage but actually increase it, allowing her to reposition on the battlefield constantly and effectively.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Due to baked-in dash attacks in most of her attack sequences, Zhu Yuan gains small moments of invulnerability mid-combo, providing her with an edge in combat survivability.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At the time of her release, Zhu Yuan is the only Ether DPS, giving her a unique niche in the game.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Good cleave-based hitboxes on almost all attacks for a character that is mostly ranged DPS.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan is a combo-based character who can take a bit of practice to pick up and play perfectly, presenting a learning curve for new players.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"At present, Zhu Yuan lacks synergistic teammate options outside of 4-star characters, though more from her faction are expected soon.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Zhu Yuan's damage output is significantly weaker when enhanced shells are not available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Quick Reload
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan activates Chain Attacks/Ultimates, gain the Quick Reload effect. When Zhu Yuan has the Quick Reload effect and uses up all Enhanced Shotshells, the Quick Reload effect will be consumed to instantly gain 6/9 Enhanced Shotshells.

talents.name: Ether Ember
talents.desc: In Suppressive Mode, Zhu Yuan’s Anti-Interrupt level is increased and DMG taken reduced by 10%. When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, the target takes 10% more Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower DMG, stacking up to 5 times and lasting for 5s. Each shot adds one stack of this effect, and repeated triggers reset the duration.

talents.name: Public Security Special Training
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ether Perforation
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan hits an enemy with Enhanced Shotshells, her Basic Attack: Please Do Not Resist and Dash Attack: Overwhelming Firepower ignore 25% of the target’s Ether RES.

talents.name: Special Ops Experience
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Expanded Energy Pack III
talents.desc: When Zhu Yuan consumes a total of 12 Enhanced Shotshells, she receives the Ether Afterglow effect, and the Energy cost of the next EX Special Attack is reduced by 30. Launching an EX Special Attack will consume Ether Afterglow and shoot an additional 4-bullet Ether Buckshot. Each extra bullet deals DMG equal to 220% of Zhu Yuan's ATK.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Leader of Public Security's Criminal Investigation team, Zhu Yuan, standing by. You can come to me if you need any help. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar is S-Rank Melee Physical Defense Agent, excelling at providing both offensive and defensive buffs, while inflicting Daze equivalent to Stun Agents.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" What sets her apart from others is her amazing Shield “Radiant Aegis” that for sure is the strongest support skill in the game (at the time of her release). ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"This combined with her Support and Stun skills makes her an incredible addition to various endgame compositions.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The entirety of her kit revolves around the “Radiant Aegis” Shield, granted by her Core Passive - Barrier of Resilience. It allows “Radiant Aegis” to be gained by any of the following actions:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (When triggered via retaliation)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Chain Attack: Road Rage Slam","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ultimate: Savage Smash","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Once used, “Radiant Aegis” protects the entire team with a Shield equal to Caesar’s 1400% of Base Impact + 1400 (at maximum rank). ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"The shield boasts incredible uptime, has no re-application cooldown, and transfers to active character on the field without delay","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", allowing you permanent access as long as you retrigger it as needed. “Radiant Aegis” is more than a Barrier - it increases Attack by 1000, and increases their Anti-Interrupt value for the duration of Shield + for additional 5 seconds after it breaks. Furthermore, no single instance of damage can exceed the Shield’s total value, granting protection from being one-shotted/massive hits. As such, the versatility and strength of this Shield makes it one of strongest buffs available, providing her team with a powerful mix of Survivability and Damage.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Additional Ability - Battle Spirit, requires at least one teammate who can perform a Defensive Assist or belongs to the same Faction to activate. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Enhancing her Support capabilities, Caesar applies 25% Damage Increase debuff to enemies with a 7m radius lasting for 30 seconds, when hitting with any of the following abilities:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Triggering a Retaliation via Ability use or Perfect Block (Special mechanics we’ll cover below)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Defensive Assist: Aegis Shield","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Basic Attack: Dead End","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We will analyze each of them soon, but the important part is that the debuff is easy to apply, lasts long and will always be active. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The combination of these Abilities is the driving force behind her kit - with her goal in combat being keeping these buffs active while dishing out as much Daze as possible. To understand the optimal method, let us dive into her Active Abilities. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"She possesses two different Basic Attacks. Her 6 Part Attack Combo has low damage and Daze multipliers, limiting its usage. On the other hand, her held Basic Attack - Dead End is much more impactful - it requires an Assist Point to perform and launches Shields in all directions, pulling enemies closer, granting her Temporary Invulnerability.","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Most importantly it applies her Additional Ability - Battle Spirit, without relying on enemies attacking her.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" This Basic Attack is not part of her main game plan but can be a powerful asset to trigger her Additional Ability in a pinch when the enemy isn’t attacking you. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Special Attack and EX Special Attack feature two variants each, sharing somewhat similar mechanics. With her Special Attack being more situational in use, we will be focusing on her EX Special Attack in this guide, as its primary focus of most of her combos .","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The two types of her EX are as follows:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack - Parry Counter is Forward Shield Slam dealing Physical Damage and strong Daze, costing 40 Energy. Her second EX Special Attack - Overpowered Shield Bash deals even stronger damage and Daze at half the cost (20 Energy), but you need to:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Launch her EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX) first.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Gain Retaliation via an Ability or a Perfect Block.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The first condition is easy and allows you to use two EX’s back to back forming one of Caesar’s more effective combos:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The second condition “Retaliation” is a special state granted to Caesar after using some of her Abilities or by executing a “Perfect Block”. Perfect Block is a special mechanic associated exclusively with the following abilities:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Parry Counter (1st EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (2nd EX)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Special Attack: Shockwave Shield Bash","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"When using any of these abilities while an enemy is attacking her, she will instead perform a “Perfect Block” empowered version of the ability, gaining Immunity from attack and staggering the enemy. Of course, she can immediately execute her 2nd EX Special Attack right after.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Using her 1st EX Special Attack grants her access to 2nd EX Special Attack already, so when performing a Perfect Block with 1st EX, it instead reduces the subsequent 2nd EX Special Attack energy cost from 20 to 0. Meanwhile, performing Perfect Block with her 2nd EX Special Attack refunds the 20 energy used to cast it, without allowing her to trigger it again. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her EX’s are indeed a bit confusing so just remember, if possible, to use her EX to interrupt enemy attacks to gain some additional benefits and whenever gaining Retaliation, ensure you make a quick use of her 2nd EX Special Attack. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Dodge Abilities are decent, but are a little more specific in usage and aren't regularly used as other characters.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" When an enemy attacks it’s generally preferred to trigger a Defensive Assist or go for a Perfect Block with her Special Ability over a Dodge or Dash Attack. With that said, her Dodge Counter deals good Daze to enemies and her Dash Attack, if timed perfectly, can allow her access to Retaliation without the bonus of a Perfect Block.  ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Quick Assist is simple and won’t be utilized often. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"But the combo of her Defensive Assist and Assist Follow-Up is incredibly strong and integral to her gameplay.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Her Defensive Assist parries attack, similar to most characters and applies her Additional Ability debuff, but the Assist Follow Up you can execute right after is particularly amazing. Using it causes reasonable damage, strong Daze and allows Caesar to immediately enter Retaliation and follow-up with her 2nd EX Special Attack - Overpowered Shield Bash. The combination of these 3 abilities form the Core of her kit as executing them mitigates an enemy attack, deal strong Daze, activate/refresh her Core Passive Shield, grant an Attack Boost and apply her Damage Taken Increase debuff to all enemies in minimal field time at and cheap cost of 1 Assist Point and 20 Energy. To Sum it up: ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar Core Combo:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Defensive Assist: Aegis Shield (Activates Additional Ability: Battle Spirit)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Assist Follow-Up: Aiding Blade (Gain Retaliation)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash (Activates Core Ability: Radiant Aegis)","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This specific combo lets Caesar inflict Daze per second equivalent to some of the strongest Stun Type Agents in the game","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", allowing her to substitute for that role while bringing a multitude of supportive capabilities. This combo achieves most of what Caesar aims to provide and keeping her off field, barring taking her out to trigger Defensive Assists or dump excess Energy is a completely viable and recommended way to play even.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Her Ultimate and Chain Attack feature two Unique benefits. Her Ultimate deals additional 100% Daze to enemies with Shield whereas her Chain Attack has a very short animation. These features can help optimize certain fights or against certain Bosses, but otherwise remain less important as she is primarily a Support Agent. As such other characters Ultimates will take precedence over her usually. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Rounding off her kit, she has one more Passive bonus up her sleeve. Whenever she gains Retaliation or performs a Perfect Block or executes a Defensive Assist, she gets a buff called Stance Switch, granting her 20% Combat Impact for 3s (At Maximum). This makes the combo mentioned prior even stronger and doubles down on performing Retaliations, Perfect Blocks and Defensive Assists above anything else. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Caesar is one of the easiest to use and most impactful agents at the time of her release, offering insane damage increases, a busted Barrier that prevents damage, Interrupts attacks, and inflicts strong Daze with Defensive Assists in mind.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" Having both Defensive and Offensive utility, flexibility in team building, and strong numbers across the board makes her the best Support in the game and she will potentially remain there for quite a long time.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For optimal strategies for combining all of Caesar’s skills, refer to the Rotation & Teams section of this guide.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

build.substats: [CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > PEN = ATK] OR [Anomaly Profiency > ATK% > PEN > ATK]

talents.name: Spearhead Advance
talents.desc: When Caesar enters combat or switches in, she instantly buffs the entire team with a Radiant Aegis shield, which can be can be triggered once every 300s. While Radiant Aegis is active, enemies within a 5m radius of the shield bearer suffer a 15% Attribute DMG RES reduction.

talents.name: Legacy of the Far Lands
talents.desc: While Radiant Aegis is active during Core Passive: Barrier of Resilience, Caesar's Energy Generation increases by 10%, and the shield bearer's attack boost is increased to 150% of its original value.

talents.name: Absolute Trust
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Aries the Battering-Ram
talents.desc: When Caesar uses a Chain Attack or Ultimate, she gains 3 additional Assist Points. If her Energy is below 20, she can activate EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash with 1 Assist Point instead. This substitution can only be triggered once every 5s.

talents.name: Romantic Conquest
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Overlord's Will
talents.desc: EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash and Assist Follow-Up is guaranteed to trigger a critical hit. The skill's DMG is increased by 50% with an additional damage of 50% dealt to the primary target. When Caesar uses EX Special Attack: Overpowered Shield Bash or Assist Follow-Up, her CRIT Rate is increased by 30% and her CRIT DMG is increased by 60% for 15s. Repeated triggers reset the duration.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice is a S-Rank Melee Fire Anomaly Agent who brings forth a unique playstyle of passively dealing a good part of her damage and Anomaly Buildup while being off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Complimenting this, she doesn’t require much time on-field in first place, and to no surprise of anyone, being an Anomaly character she excels at applying and amplifying Burn Disorder quickly and consistently - making her a top choice for Anomaly/Disorder teams, especially ones with characters who can take up the field-time Burnice doesn’t really require. To understand exactly what makes this Pyromaniac cyclist work let's dive into her playstyle and kit! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her play style primarily focuses on marking enemies with her special “Scorch” status and building & utilizing her special resource “Heat” - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"all the while taking minimal field time and using her most powerful abilities to apply massive amounts of Fire Anomaly. Enemies that are Scorched by Burnice suffer great damage and Anomaly when hit by any squad member other than Burnice. That's possible thanks to her Core Passive (that works even when she's off-field) at the cost of consuming her “Heat” count slightly. Continuously triggering Afterburn on Scorched targets is her game plan and in order to do the same she needs to build and maintain a good amount of “Heat” consistently. It can be achieved by either using her Ultimate or spending energy. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"This leads to a gameplay loop of Scorching the enemies, building and maintaining “Heat” with EX-Special/Ultimate, and going off-field. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now with the basics covered let's get into the nitty gritty! ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Core Passive - Nitro-Fuel Cocktail is the source of her most important mechanics - “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status and Afterburn damage off-field. Let’s start with “Heat” first Burnice starts the battle with and can hold up to 100 “Heat” at a time. She gains 1.4 “Heat” per 1 energy spent and upon reaching 50 “Heat” enters the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State which she will maintain until her “Heat” reaches 0. After which she’ll need to reach 50 again to re-enter.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State she gains access to a new Enhanced Basic Attack and is able to apply the “Scorch” status when hitting enemies with any of the following abilities: ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend (Nitro-Fuel Cocktail Enhanced Basic Attack)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Any EX-Special Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Ultimate","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As mentioned earlier, whenever a Scorched enemy takes damage from a squad member other than Burnice, they suffer Afterburn taking up to 350% of Burnice’s ATK as Assist Attack","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"type damage immediately and a good chunk of Fire Anomaly buildup at the cost of 8 “Heat” per activation. Afterburn can only trigger once every 1.5 seconds and as soon as the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state ends at 0 “Heat” all scorches will be removed immediately. As an added bonus for every 10 Anomaly Proficiency Burnice has, her Afterburn damage is boosted by 1% up to 30% (Requires 300 Anomaly Proficiency). ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s standard Basic Attack is a multi-part combo consisting of 5 attacks with Physical and Fire hits mixed in. None of these hits deal much damage or interact with “Heat” resource, “Scorch” status, or Afterburn so aren’t usually used. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Bar this she gains access to the Special Charged Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend when in the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail State. Upon pressing and holding the Basic Attack button, she immediately consumes up to 20 “Heat” to perform a channeled spinning attack that applies “Scorch”, good Fire Anomaly, and deals reasonable damage. This ability is ideal for quick application of “Scorch” without any conditions or consumption of energy when you have maximum “Heat”, additionally while this ability consumes up to 20 “Heat” it is still useable with even 1 “Heat” as long as you’re still within the Nitro-Fuel Cocktail state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice’s Dash Attack and Dodge Counter, similar to her standard Basic Attacks, have no bearing on her “Heat” or “Scorch” mechanics so they aren’t used outside of niche scenarios where you need to avoid damage or close a gap.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Also in a similar vein is her Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up. These attacks do reasonable damage and apply strong Anomaly for their field-time requirements but aren’t critical for her gameplay. As such if the opportunity to use them arises they’re worthwhile but not mandatory in any case.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Her Ultimate as we’ve covered earlier is an ability you should absolutely consider using whenever the team has the Decibels available and her “Heat” isn’t capped out","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":". It hits incredibly hard, deals a tremendous amount of Anomaly, and takes up very little field time for how effective it is - all thanks to the fact that halfway through casting it she triggers a Quick Assist for her teammates and can switch out while she continues casting it off-field. On top of all this, her Ultimate generates her 50 “Heat” allowing her to keep her Afterburn trigger continuously without being solely reliant on her energy if timed correctly. Her Chain attack is also worth using when available as long as no other team member requires their Chain Attack to function - it deals a decent chunk of damage, large amounts of Fire Anomaly build-up, and is relatively quick to use. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Final,ly let's talk about her Special and EX-Special attacks. As with most characters, Burnice’s standard Special Attack isn’t used. Although when it comes to her EX she has two of them - “Standard Shot” and “Double Shot” - both of them are channeled Flamethrower attacks that deal continuous damage, massive Fire Anomaly, consume energy over a short duration and deal an explosion at the end. The difference between the two is as follows:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" “Standard Shot” consumes a relatively small amount of energy over its duration, makes use of only one of her Flamethrowers, and allows her to reposition mid-channel by strafing left or right. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"“Double Shot” on the other hand consumes significantly more energy (over 2x), uses both of her Flamethrowers, deals more Anomaly and damage, lacks repositioning, and has an activation requirement.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In most cases, it’s advisable to use “Double Shot” as it has a similar channel time to “Single Shot” but does significantly more damage and Anomaly application while also converting her energy into “Heat” at a faster pace. In order to access “Double Shot” when using the EX-Special instead of the standard “Single Shot” simply tap the EX twice in quick succession (which will cause it to swap from “Single” to “Double” after a short delay) or make use of the EX immediately after any of the following abilities to skip out on having to double tap the ability (Executes with no delay);","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: MIxed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Chain Attack: Fuel-Fed Flame","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Assist Follow-Up: Scorching Dew","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a final bonus, her Additional Ability grants her 65% additional Fire Anomaly Buildup to the following abilities;","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Mixed Flame Blend","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Both EX Special Attacks “Single” and “Double”","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Afterburn","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"On top of this, it also extends all Burns inflicted by the squad by 3 seconds. It goes without saying this Additional Ability is worth activating and should always be a goal to consider when building a team for Burnice.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now let’s bring it all together - when playing Burnice all you need to worry about is to keep your enemy consistently Scorched and maintain a healthy amount of “Heat” via timely Ultimate and EX-Special “Double Shot” use. Outside of this other abilities can be optionally used but focusing on granting your allies as much field time as possible while her Afterburn constantly triggers is generally her best play. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"As it should be clear by now that without “Heat”, she can’t make use of a very large part of her kit and to maintain it she either needs a steady supply of energy for EX’s or the use of her Ultimate. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As such she is definitely one of the more energy-hungry characters - more so in long drawn-out fights. To remedy this somewhat ensure no “Heat” is wasted when using EX-Specials or Ultimates.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In conclusion, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Burnice serves as a top-tier Anomaly Sub-DPS option","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" especially when paired with characters who can make use of the field-time she frees up. If you’re looking to further invest into Anomaly, specifically Disorder, she's a great addition to any endgame roster. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As a Sub-DPS who doesn't need to steal the field time from other characters, she can be easily slotted into various teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible Fire Anomaly Application - ideal for Burn or Disorder-focused teams.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can deal a significant portion of her damage and Anomaly application while off-field doubling down on her low field-time playstyle.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has surprisingly high direct damage multipliers for an Anomaly character giving her the option to gain extra damage through stats such as Critical Rate and Critical Damage if you find it on gear.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy To Play.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Kindred Flames
talents.desc: Increases the limit of Heat from 100 to 140. Upon entering the battlefield, Burnice accumulates an additional 40 Heat. Increases the DMG Multiplier of the Afterburn effect by 100% of Burnice's ATK. Additionally, the accumulated Fire Anomaly Buildup from the Afterburn effect is increased by 25%.

talents.name: Extra at No Additional Charge
talents.desc: When triggering the Afterburn effect, Thermal Penetration is applied to the enemy, stacking up to 5 times and lasting 6s. Repeated triggers reset the duration. When any allied unit in the squad hits the enemy, the attack's PEN Ratio is increased by 4% for each stack of Thermal Penetration, up to a max of 20%.

talents.name: Optimistic by Nature
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Ultimate Fuel Supply
talents.desc: When an EX Special Attack or Assist Attack hits an enemy, the move's CRIT Rate increases by 30%. The max flame spray duration of EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot is increased by 1s.

talents.name: Dance of Fire and Ice
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Burning Invitation
talents.desc: When Burnice hits an enemy with EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, it triggers an additional special Afterburn effect, dealing 60% of Burnice's ATK as Fire DMG to the target. This effect can trigger once every 0.5s and does not consume Heat. After hitting an enemy with EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, while the move is active, EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot, special Afterburn effects, and Burn effects will ignore 25% of the target's Fire RES. When EX Special Attack: Intense Heat Stirring Method - Double Shot's fire blast hits an enemy, if that enemy is Burned, trigger an additional instance of Burn DMG equal to 1,800% of the original DMG. This effect can trigger once every 20s for each target.

introduction.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Burnice, the Nitro-Fuel bartender for the Sons of Calydon. A hopeless fuel lover. She is responsible for all the fuel used by the machinery owned by the Sons of Calydon. She seems to have a passion for fuel that overwhelms all else. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yanagi is an S-Rank Melee Electric Anomaly Agent who serves as a main field Anomaly DPS and specializes in dealing and amplifying Disorder damage. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Traditionally, Disorder first requires you to have an Anomaly on an enemy and then trigger another one of a different type to activate. However, what makes Yanagi unique is her ability to completely bend these rules with her special mechanic “Polarity Disorder” which she can access via her Ultimate or EX-Special Attack.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" Polarity Disorder allows Yanagi to trigger a “mini” Disorder on demand ignoring enemies Anomaly build-up and also whether current Anomaly on the enemy is different from Yanagi’s own","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" (Yanagi being an Electric Agent can trigger Polarity Disorder on Shock). This singular part of her kit alone carves out a place for her in the endgame meta as one of the strongest Anomaly DPS in the game, but of course that’s far from all she has to offer.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her playstyle is straightforward but challenging to master, as it features multiple buffs to keep active, many different combos, and when played in Disorder teams a lot of Character-Swaps and Anomaly management.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outside of Polarity Disorder, the other mechanic that makes her stand out is a special stance mechanic. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yanagi has two stances, “Jougen” Stance and “Kagen” Stance which she can freely swap between. Each stance changes her Basic Attack pattern and grants her a buff while active. Stances can be swapped through the use of a Special Attack or EX-Special Attack and doing so will allow Yanagi to retain the buff from her previous stance for 8 seconds on top of gaining the buff of the stance she just entered.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" Getting both buffs at once is a great incentive for swapping between stances already, but the benefits don’t end there.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" Swapping between stances also allows her to execute combos faster and activate her must-use Additional Ability “Gesso”. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"With all that said, the game plan is: to Swap Stances, execute shortened combos, maintain all buffs, use EX Special’s and Ultimates to trigger Polarity Disorder and manage team Anomaly to trigger standard Disorders as you would in any normal Anomaly team. Sounds pretty easy right? Not so much… ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Well fortunately it’s not quite as complicated as it sounds so let's dive into the nitty gritty of her kit to break it down.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Yanagi’s Basic attacks are at the heart of most of her combos and as we’ve learned she has two different sets - one for each of the stances. Which stance you’re currently in and which buffs you have active can be tracked in the top left of the screen (If both sides are lit up you have both buffs!).","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Each set of Basic Attacks consists of a 5-part combo including 2 Physical Attacks (Basic 1 and 2) and 3 Electric Attacks (Basic 3, 4 and 5). Both stance combos take roughly the same amount of time to execute, but there are some slight differences regardless, excluding the buffs you gain in each stance. Here is what to look out for:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Jougen Here is an example of a common attack sequence:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Dodge Counter: Rapid Retaliation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Kagen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Now that we know most of her combos and how stances work, swapping stances and dealing massive damage via Polarity Disorder is next and both are associated with her Special Attacks.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Unlike most characters, Yanagi's standard Special Attack is actually incredibly useful. Attack: Gekka Ruten causing her to perform a two-part attack consisting of a Thrusting Dash and Downward Smash dealing tremendous Anomaly build-up and most importantly, triggering Polarity Disorder. Polarity disorder occurs the moment the smash lands and it behaves similarly to a standard Disorder but instead only deals 15% of the usual damage.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" However, it has another special base damage multiplier added to it - equalling to 3200% of Yanagi’s Attribute Proficiency (at max rank). ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The mix of these multipliers ensures decently damaging hits but also has the upside of triggering huge Disorders through Burn, Shock, and Corruption Anomalies when played right. As a difference from the norm and as an added bonus - Polarity Disorder ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"will not","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" remove the Anomaly from the enemy. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In addition to Polarity Disorder, using her EX-Special Attack also grants her the “Shinrabanshou state” for 15 seconds. While in the “Shinrabanshou state” whenever Yanagi uses Basic Attack 5 she’ll immediately be able to execute Basic Attack 3 right after without any assistance. You’ll have this buff up a good amount of combat making her optimal Basic Attack combo just that much more consistent.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Similar to her standard Special Attack Yanagi’s EX also changes her stance on use but unlike the standard one, this allows her to move straight into Basic Attack 3 regardless of what came before it making it a good tool to start your Basic Attack combo if no other abilities with the signature effect are available. With enough energy available combos like the following are possible:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"EX Special Attack: Gekka Ruten (Enter Shinrabanshou state)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P3","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P4","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Basic Attack: Tsukuyomi Kagura: Jougen P5","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The other ability that can trigger Polarity Disorder is her Ultimate, which does damage at the same rate of 15% of Disorder and 3200% of Attribute Proficiency -  making it worth using if you can spare the team's Decibels, but not mission critical for her gameplan. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Outside of triggering Polarity Disorder her Ultimate is very standard, primarily offering a tremendous amount of Electric Anomaly.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The rest of Yanagi’s kit including her Dodge Counter, Chain Attack, Quick Assist and Assist Follow-Up are all simple direct damage strikes that apply a strong amount of Anomaly Build-Up but lack any special effect outside of skipping Basic Attack 1 and 2. All are worth using if the situation arises but none are core to her rotation or gameplan; use them at your discretion as they’re available.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Rounding off her kit is her Core Passive: Lunar Eclipse, which increases the base multiplier of Disorder damage from 450% to 700% (at max rank) for the whole squad for 15 seconds when using her EX-Special attack. ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"How impactful this bonus will be depends on the Anomaly Disorder you’re triggering, but it’s always worth keeping active. As an added benefit after striking an enemy with her EX she also increases the Electric Damage% against them by 20% for 15 seconds doubling up on the buff value.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Lastly,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":" her Additional ability grants her a 45% Electric Anomaly build-up increase on the first Basic Attack she does following a stance change lasting for 8 seconds.","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" This buff timing lines up perfectly with the lingering benefits of each stance making maintaining it no extra effort for what is ultimately a huge boost.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"To conclude, ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Yanagi cheats the system by being able to access Disorder at any time with no strings attached regardless of team composition","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":", can infinitely string together high Anomaly Basic Attack combos making for excellent sustained damage regardless of resources, can amplify her own (and the team) Disorder multipliers and has incredible burst on demand if you’re willing to pull out all the stops. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"At the time of her release Yanagi is absolutely one of the best DPS in the game,","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" able to stand alone with Supports or alongside another Anomaly powerhouse of your choosing. While she’s combo-heavy, a bit challenging to play, and wants a good amount of field time to facilitate her Basic Attack sequences and Stance-Swaps, the payoff is well worth the investment if your team can work alongside her.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

build.substats: Anomaly Proficiency > ATK% > PEN = ATK

talents.name: Know Thy Self, Know Thy Enemy
talents.desc: When any squad member inflicts an Anomaly on an enemy, Yanagi gains 1 stack of Clarity, lasting 15s, stacking up to 3 times. Repeated triggers reset the duration. Upon being hit by an enemy attack, Yanagi consumes 1 stack of Clarity to gain invulnerability for 1s. When Yanagi has 1 or more stacks of Clarity, her Anomaly Proficiency increases by 80.

talents.name: Outstanding Adaptability
talents.desc: During her EX Special Attack, the rapid thrust's Electric Anomaly Buildup increases by 20%. Holding down the Special Attack button after a rapid thrust hits an enemy will consume 10 additional Energy to launch another thrust. If Energy is insufficient or the button is released, the attack automatically follows up with the downward attack. When the downward attack hits an enemy suffering an Anomaly and triggers Polarity Disorder, the DMG multiplier increases to 20% of the original Disorder effect. Each additional thrust increases this multiplier by 15%, up to a maximum of 2 extra thrusts.

talents.name: Tsukishiro Style Management
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Chessmaster
talents.desc: When Yanagi inflicts Attribute Anomaly DMG on an enemy, they suffer the Exposed effect, lasting 15s. Attacks on enemies under the Expose effect will have 16% increased PEN Ratio.

talents.name: Other Mother
talents.desc: Basic Attack, Dodge, Special Attack, and Chain Attack Lv. +2

talents.name: Inhuman Blood
talents.desc: After a thrust attack during her EX Special Attack, the duration of the Shinrabanshou state increases to 30s. While the state is active and her EX Special Attack DMG increases by 20%. The maximum number of times the additional DMG multiplier increase effect for Polarity Disorder in Outstanding Adaptability can be triggered increases to 4, and the Energy cost for the first 4 additional thrust attacks is halved.
